title: vsync on, fps still over 100+
body: my current laptop i have is a dell inspiron 15 7567 gaming laptop with gtx 1050ti. when i turn on vsync on the nvidia control panel, my games are still uncapped and i want it to be at 60 fps. the monitor is 60hz. the only way i can cap my laptop to 60 fps is when i turn vsync on in the game settings. without vsync on in game, league runs almost 200 fps. i mean thats good and all but when my laptop runs at max performance its super loud and i dont like that. what was the point of having a nvidia control panel when my games dont cap at 60 fps unless i turn it on in game? i recently switched to pc and im still new to these things, if anyone can help it would be appreciated!

replies.body: I recommend using the in-game settings instead for this to make it specific to League.  There is an option in-game via video settings to cap your framerate.  Let me know if that option helps!
this is what i do. i cap it at 60 fps with the wait for vsync option checked just below the fps cap options.
